intro: Richardsonia tricocca, commonly known as the three-leafed broomrape, is a parasitic flowering plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its lack of true roots, stems, and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions where it attaches to various host species. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant ecological impacts on its host plants.
